title: [Large-scale] Constructivist-based Distance Science Inquiry Learning Design: Variable Control and Evidence-Based Conclusion Drawing

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational scientific knowledge (experimental design, data measurement, evidence analysis), understanding of variable control, online learning experience, and comprehension of constructivist learning approaches
context.additional_context: Instructional design based on modeling languages to support constructivist scientific inquiry in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Learners develop abilities to collect and interpret scientific evidence through systematic observation, precise measurement, and data analysis. Trains deriving valid conclusions based on experimental results.

learning_goals: Learners enhance real-world problem-solving skills through constructivist-based science concept modeling (including hypothesis setting, independent/dependent variable control, iterative experiment design).

Using EML-based tools (e.g., EML Studio), learners design ≥3 self-directed inquiry learning scenarios (goal setting, experimental resource selection, quantitative evaluation methods) and create scientific analysis environments that receive average peer feedback scores of ≥4/5 from 2 evaluators.

Learners reflect on and improve the science knowledge-building process (hypothesis verification, data analysis, experimental error evaluation, conclusion drawing) through peer feedback and collaborative activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
